Award.AwardTitle: The Method of Anchored Distributions (MAD): Principles and Implementation as a Community Resource
Award.AbstractNarration:
The Method of Anchored Distributions (MAD): Principles and
Implementation as a Community Resource

This project will develop a community-based, open-source computational platform for Bayesian inverse modeling and conditional simulations in hydrology. It is driven by the need to provide easily-accessible tools for applications and a platform for broad-based, long-term development, built to meet the challenges brought upon by the ever increasing complexity of modern computational tools, the diversity of data types and the breadth and depth of the subject matters needed for applications. The project is inspired by the success experienced by other communities with a long tradition of community-based development efforts. We will construct a kernel that will include a modular computational platform and a user-interface that will allow users and developers to link the kernel with their models. The kernel will be built using open-source architecture. The primary focus will be on developing a standalone version (for large-scale applications at the user?s computers). The kernel will be interoperable with a wide array of community-based resources (such as CUAHSI?s hydrologic information systems) and libraries (such as R). With these concepts and principles, various types of data could be assimilated, simplifying assumptions could be adopted at the user?s discretion, and powerful numerical models and analytical tools, current or under development, could be used as a focal point for long-term community-based development. The project developers will coordinate the project with CUAHSI. CUHASI will act as the custodian of the MAD computational platform. This implies securing the integrity of the MAD kernel, updating it and making it available to users and developers. This effort is in line with CUAHSI's overall strategy.

MAD will facilitate the science discovery process by making advanced inverse modeling tools available to users and an inviting development platform for developers. It will enhance the quality of hydrologic science by encouraging collaboration between hydrologists and earth scientists, and provide a platform for statisticians and computer scientists. MAD will provide educators and students with access to modern, well-documented computational tools, and with the motivation to experiment with them, because it will be understood as a general and extensible tool that is useful far beyond the classroom. MAD will make a contribution to the growing culture of community-based, open-source analytical tools that make science more accessible. Long-standing, well-tested, transparent and hence better-trusted analytical tools form the base for a constructive public discourse on matters relating to environmental regulations.

POR.DRECONTENT:
MAD# is an open-source, stochastic inverse modeling framework capable of using different forward models such as MODFLOW and HYDRUS.  It has a flexible architecture that allows applying different inverse modeling technologies, e.g. Method of Anchored Distributions (MAD) and Non-linear Optimization algorithm (Levenberg- Marquardt). MAD# has been developed in modules that connect with other numerical models through the implementation of drivers. A new master driver architecture has been added in the framework that reduces the complexity of connecting other numerical models. The master driver handles numerical models through control files. It provides an easy configuration approach that reduces the time for applying a Bayesian inverse method for calibration and allows configuring the driver for supporting the Open Modeling Interface (OpenMI) specification. The generic approach of this driver provides more flexibility in the selection and identification of model parameters in the inversion.

The source code is available at mad.codeplex.com

The master driver can be used to link the Bayesia inverse modeling theory of MAD to a wide range of applications, with minimal user intervention: users need only to providea few simple command which will tell MAD where to find what. The master driver is focused on controlling stand-alone numerical models, which are widely used by the scientific community. Although the driver architecture of MAD# allows developers to link numerical models to the framework through specialized drivers that require advanced programming, the new master driver provides a simple methodology to link numerical models in an inverse modeling framework for characterizing the structural model parameters. The open architecture of the master driver allows the users to introduce the numerical models directly in an OpenMI framework. Researchgers indicated that the pruimary barrier to implementing advanced inverse modeling solutions in field studies is the difficulty linking the inverse engine with numerical models, which requires complex algorithms. Our study demonstrates that the master driver approach can handle different types of numerical models using a control file and implementing a simple interface. It has been tested extensively and is available at no cost to users. Several hundred downloads of the source codes were registered already. Last Modified: 02/21/2016 Submitted by: Yoram Rubin
